summary: This document details an FBI interview with Robert Couturier regarding his interactions with Jeffrey Epstein. Couturier was approached by Epstein to decorate his homes but ultimately declined due to discomfort with the nature of the project, which included designing a room for young girls. The document outlines Couturier's experiences, including a lawsuit from Epstein and a subsequent settlement.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is the agent who drafted the communication regarding the interview of Robert Couturier.

persons.name: Robert Couturier
persons.context: Robert Couturier was interviewed about his work with Jeffrey Epstein, detailing his discomfort with the project and the subsequent legal issues.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the central figure in the document, having hired Couturier for decorating projects that raised concerns.

connections.description: Couturier was hired by Epstein to decorate his homes but ultimately did not complete the work due to discomfort with the project.

events.title: Interview of Robert Couturier
events.description: Robert Couturier was interviewed by the FBI regarding his interactions with Jeffrey Epstein and the work he was contracted to do.

events.title: Couturier's Settlement with Epstein
events.description: Couturier settled a lawsuit with Epstein by returning $15,000 after initially receiving a $50,000 deposit.

keyFacts: Robert Couturier was approached by Jeffrey Epstein to decorate his homes but declined due to discomfort with the nature of the project.
Couturier was given a $50,000 deposit but never signed a contract with Epstein.
Epstein sued Couturier for the deposit, leading to a settlement where Couturier returned $15,000.
Couturier expressed concerns about decorating a room specifically for young girls visiting Epstein.
Couturier provided contact information for Epstein and his employees during the interview.
